rows.heading: Controlling Erosion
rows.description: Soil erosion carries away the topsoil which contains nutrients and life thus degrading the overall health of your soil. Here are some erosion control methods.

rows.heading: Recycling
rows.description: Improve the health of your soil by recycling and re-using farm waste products. Plants need carbon to grow healthy and strong and you can keep soil carbon levels high by recycling plant debris and manure.

rows.heading: Mixed Farming
rows.description: Mixed farming is the integration of crops and livestock enterprises. Animal waste, that is urine and poop, are rich resources that improve soil fertility and so make crops thrive.

rows.heading: Plant Diversity
rows.description: Incorporating different types of crops and practices on the farm helps improve overall crop production and soil health.
